I still believe that a Washington office for N/EB is important for the
long range development of educational broadcasting* Why don*t you try
to discover a new avenue through which you may work on Kellogg to get
them to underwrite a new five year plan for N/EB* which will include
the Washington office in addition to some new activities at headquarters?
I don*t know whether Kellogg*s enthusiasm for educational broadcasting
can be revived or not but a new attack on them through someone close to
Seay might be successful*
I have written Bob VanDuyn asking hi; to come by to see us here on his
next swing south. If X can find the chance to talk to him with some ease
I nay be able to find out what the real attitude is there at Battle Creek
My work moves along here toward launching TV programming in February or
March, It is a busy time but not so hectic as it was when I was also
trying to stay on top of N/EB business* As I have said before, I am glad
you are on that assignment and I am trying to do a good job of one job*
I make no promise but I still have hopes of clearing the NAEB files one
of these days and sending them along to you. Since headquarters has
copies of practically everything, there is no big rush*
Warmest regards always*
Sincerely yours.
